POOF.content: when Nietzsche spectralizes the enemy, no longer reassurance of an identifiable enemy (of a figure at least): not a new ear of peace, human fraternity, but unprecedented violence  > thus Schmitt’s desire, in tradition of modernity (Hegel), to re-configure the enemy
for Schmitt, political needs figure of enemy & determined possibility of an actual war
a phobia, a conjuration (of the enemy) which puts an end to depoliticization (Entpolitisierung)
disappearance of enemy, glas of the political as such
for Schmitt, any discussion of humanity is outside the political: there is no enemy of humanity > enemy is always public
Schmitt’s political difference assumes opposition, a determined opposition: friend/enemy > should it erase itself: no politics

in Schmitt, enemy passes from possible to eventual to effective-actuality (reale Möglichkeit) > this passage is a way to deny the abyss: war is, immediately, in the realm of the political—as soon as it is possible, it is taking place
for Schmitt, concept of enemy as very concept of political must purify itself of, reduce (phenomenologically even), all individuality, all privacy
Schmitt’s use of Latin & Greek (hostis/inimicus, polémios/ekhthrós), as a search for the ‘right name’ (question always that of the ‘right name,’ as Nietzsche would say)
Schmitt’s purification of all (personal) affect from friend-enemy distinction (its pure political essence), a war w/out intrinsic xenophobia, war w/out hatred
Schmitt’s concept of political would collapse under threats to border of friend–enemy, and it is exactly that these threats exist that makes Schmitt’s concept so prophetic and pathetic
“love your enemies” is ekhthrous not polémios [which agrees with Schmitt’s idea: polémios is the public enemy]
under Schmitt’s criteria, defending Europe against Islam would be more than a political war, it would be a combat w/ the political at stake, a struggle for politics
distinction btwn polémios and ekhthrós, btwn pólemos and stásis, found in Schmitt & in ‘obligatory necessity’ that binds Greeks to each other [?]
Schmitt’s politics demands double identification of enemy: who and what

for Schmitt, only pessimists are authentic thinkers of political fact, they presuppose what is actual/effective, know (like Hobbes), that conviction of possessing truth/fact/good/just sparks worst hostilities > [Derrida wonders/plays at whether sage or fool is the ultimate pessimist]
via Schmitt, civil war (stásis) as de-naturalization of nature, parasite, graft, difficulty of identifying this enemy
on whether Plato justifies Schmitt’s distinction: [see pp. 90-1, 134n in Laws Plato claims diastasis is right name for civil war]

via Plato, no prâxis can correspond to indications contained in a léxis ——since politics is essentially a prâxis, no politics can be adequate to purity of Schmitt’s concept re: enemy > politics as that which situates very place of a concept’s inadequation to itself [?]
Schmitt will attempt to frame, de jure, the science of the purely political, will hierarchize, offer a topology
Schmitt (pathetic, in vain) dreams (Platonically) of political purity at very spot where it’s contaminated
Schmitt’s enemy is one of practical identification, must know who the enemy is [p. 125 ‘who’ is at heart of principle of political, it summons & demands]
Schmitt’s obsessive use of ‘concrete,’ always haunted by the spectral (gespenstisch), which, for Schmitt, is a synonym of ‘abstract’ or ‘empty’ > his book formed amidst these tensions
Schmitt claims to be writing a purely theoretical diagnostics of the political, uses “diagnostics” as alibi in Nuremberg

[re: Schmitt] structural disavowal that informs/constructs political discourse [that theory of politics must be performed, sides must be taken], principle of affirmation & ruin at heart of most coherent gestures > figure of tautology we were calling teleiopoetic [?]
since ‘concrete’ enemy is spoken of in ‘everyday language,’ Schmitt cannot absolutely formalize
for Schmitt, State presupposes the political, yet (à la Hegel) the State serves as teleological pole for political > State as static, stance, status, and stásis [auto-immunity]
to preserve his strict logic, Schmitt reads civil war [party ‘depoliticization,’ internal antagonisms] as war in view of State, btwn 2 States > i.e. only one concept of war
death of enemy in war neither natural death nor crime

Schmitt’s fundamental anthropology, ontology of ‘human life’: every person is a combatant (Kämpfer), where (à la Hegel) a being-for-death that would not be a being-for-putting-to-death would still be too natural [not the death drive, this deadly drive proceeds from life]

on Schmitt’s strategy of presupposition [somewhat Heideggerian], a classically & displaced logic of possibility, where Realisierung [of war] should not be equated w/ Aristotle’s actualization: one can interact outside the political, the political is regional, and yet the political also arrives as a supplementary or overdetermining determination, can invade all of existence
does the exceptional decision decide on friends, or decide among friends?
Schmitt’s ever present presupposition of war, always present as real possibility, means it conditions possibility of political w/out being its aim or content
possibility of neutrality in Schmitt’s ontology of friend–enemy logic? only as the end of the political? [Blanchot’s neutrality is linked to friendship]

the less there’s war/killing, the more it becomes exceptional: real possibility of killing tends to be infinite > war remains the decisive ordeal (épreuve), krinein of crisis, the ‘Ernstfall,’ the discrimen, the decision discriminates

politicization thus increases in relation to depoliticization, creates hyperpoliticization, the less enemies there are, the more: this is the vertigo, mirror reflection, of ‘dying sage’ & ‘living fool,’ same # and calculation > ruin, spectrality, madness at heart of concept of political
this double hyperbole is indirectly affirmed by Schmitt in The Theory of the Partisan
for Schmitt, depoliticization, the ‘w/out politics,’ a dehumanized desert, completely pacified globe > would killing w/out blood proceed to inhuman world of war w/out war & politics?
the real possibility (die reale Möglichkeit) of friend–enemy as ‘phenomenon of the political,’ as phenomenalization, revelation, manifestation, unveiling
for Schmitt, presence of war is not a fact or example but a telos, telos of the political, sometimes this presence seems spectral, asserted cunningly, by way of testimony
Schmitt condemns annihiliation of a people or State, not ‘physical killing’ [?]
hyperbole of hyperpoliticization, total depoliticization: expands concept of political to that of absolute hostility

for Heidegger & Schmitt, technics depoliticizes & neutralizes > for Schmitt, though, there is know being-toward-death, only life against life: life confronted w/ the machine qua death is no longer life
Schmitt needs to preserve undiscoverable limit btwn private/public
when the concrete starts to resemble the ghost, inversion of signs, effect of haunting > is the ‘partisan’ Schmitt’s specter?

Schmitt’s Hegelian heritage, oppositional negativity is teleologically political (impossible to distinguish subject/object in speculative idealism); for Schmitt, Hegel fundamentally a political thinker, begins w/ Man as ‘evil,’ ‘dangerous’; for Schmitt, Marxism bears torch of Hegel in concrete-enemy of international class [Lukács]
that certain leftist circles inspired to sympathize w/ Schmitt, immense historico-political symptom
in history of partisan Schmitt details, there’s a move away from autochthony (1st partisans were nationalists), & a study of tele-technology (new speeds, new relations to space)
tele-technical prosthetic automotion breaks w/ autochthony, cuts telluric roots of 1st guerilla wars
Schmitt’s criteria [re: partisan] are false ones, quasi-concepts, criteria of degree of intensity (i.e. indefinitely extensive)

[per usual] Derrida will not accept Schmitt’s periodization of the partisan: “telluric autochthony is already a reactive response to a delocalization and to a form of tele-technology” > what Schmitt said of the partisan could have been said of most classical combatant
not simply a problem of periodization: at stake are relations btwn history of the political & the structure of theoretical concepts which one claims to articulate upon it
Schmitt accuses the Geneva Conventions of weakening, compromising, ‘system of essential distinctions’ [in the political] > placing us over abyss

[Schmitt has just led us to the abyss of the partisan] Derrida feigns restraint, one can only speak of the abyss from the shore, then he screams, swallows all assurance, voiceless talk of politics: Rwanda, Italy, ex-Yugoslavia, Palestine, Cambodia, Ukraine, the ‘Clipper’ chip…
partisan in cryptography, in unassignable ‘political’ status of psychoanalysis, in blurred borders btwn privacy/publicity, in cybercrime

re: cybercrime, ‘Clipper’ chip, etc., despite the technological mutation which produces structural effects, there’s fundamentally nothing new here > certainly, but novelty of structural effects mustn’t be neglected: the entirety of the ‘concrete’ in politics
Schmitt thinks he knows when the abyss of the partisan opened up > no matter how interesting his examples, there will always be anterior examples in an infinite regression
what Schmitt deemed the partisan Magna Carta produced to defend Prussia against Napolean—Derrida connects this to Hegel & Fichte turning to Machiavelli

for Schmitt, philosophy is productive agent of properly political, of pure hostility > via this logic, Marx is still too purely philosophical, not philosophical enough: Lenin, Mao, Stalin as figures who present possibility of re-tellurization by way of depoliticizaton > Western bourgeois capitalist as absolute enemy
via Schmitt, there can only be absolute hostility for a brother: history of friendship resembles an unavowable synonymy, a murderous tautology
the absolute war, absolute politics, absolute hostility waged against the twin, the absolute friend > if the brother is also the absolute enemy, what does fraternization mean?

via Schmitt, if enemy must be my brother & [Däubler's] Der Feind ist unser eigne Frage als Gestalt, the brother enemy is the questioning form of the question, which resembles the friend > a complaint, a crime, aggression, traumatism, war: when called into question by the question

[overflowing, rushed parentheses] Dupin [‘Purloined…’] calls himself a partisan, designates self-destruction of someone who resembles him like a brother: pitiless sympathy of war to death (among brothers) > monstrous truths, truth as monstrous

Schmitt, accused of beginning w/ the negative (the enemy), defends himself by defining definition as that which must call on its opposition, the negative > Schmitt ends up describing the pre-juridical, the origin of the juridical: via dialectical necessity
in Lysis too, w/out enemy, there’s no friend [?] > friend as pharmacological, friendship of reparation
in an essay that speaks to Benjamin, Schmitt places Hamlet btwn 2 figures of the Resistance fighter [Hamlet as partisan?]

from afar, from on high, the political is an inhabited desert w/ not a woman in sight, are sisters just species of genus brother [‘Dear Brother Jacqueline’]? is she the absolute partisan, absolute enemy of the theory of the absolute enemy? > Schmitt’s phallogocentric neutralization of sexual difference, a sealing away (sous scellés), a house arrest, vigilance of the frightened watchman (de guetteur apeuré): the political is genderless
Schmitt, in prison, reading Stirner’s The Ego and its Own, evokes Echo & Narcissus w/ deep anxiety, protective

who can be my enemy? who is the non-I? who questions me? who can I recognize as my enemy? I am not theologian, I’m a jurist [who more than Schmitt could smile at this distinction], the jurist must recognize the enemy [?], redialecticzes the conditions of the question [via Hegelian exercise]: “the brother reveals himself as my enemy,” “fraternal kiss (den Bruderkuss)”

question itself is an act of war, like recognition in Hegel, a calling into question, on se la pose depuis l’effraction ou l’infraction de l’autre > another step in the night: an enemy can only call into question he who calls himself into question > if I am my own enemy, doesn’t this call into question everything Schmitt has said?

‘all men are brothers’: a responsibility, that is always, of course, exemplary (claim to universalism) > reconciles double imperative: brother (face & mirror, original & copy, one & other) is always exemplary & that is why there’s war ——is the sister (Antigone, cf. GLAS) mute in interminable, eloquent dialectic of inimical brothers?

via & beyond Schmitt, der geschwisterlichen Klang (the brotherly-sisterly sound), the obscure friendship of rhyme, insane linking (appariement) of a couple, sense is born in a pair > before being philosophical, friendship concerns gift of the poem, isn’t there always a politics of a rhyme? > the rhyme can also become a traffic signal (philautie of linkage) > nothing looks more like the traffic signals of one country than those of another: this is the law > everything begins w/ Echo: rhymes sign, in cadence they seal a belonging, an ‘open gate’ [?]

Schmitt: extreme possibility of war gives human life its specifically political tension > Schmitt: w/out this tension there might be interesting things, but no friend–enemy meaningful antithesis whereby men could be required to sacrifice life [the morality of this situation doesn’t matter, where there is the possibility of war, this is the phenomenon of the political]
Schmitt: makes no sense to wage war for purely religious, moral, juristic, economic motives
Schmitt deduces ontology of political from friend/enemy opposition, rather than dissymmetrical fact of enmity
would Heidegger have deemed Schmitt’s depoliticization nihilist, the truth of politics carried out to its metaphysical completion? Schmitt as last great metaphysician of politics?
Schmitt preserves metaphysical opposition while registering effacement of fundamental (onto-theological) distinctions [i.e. the Cold War, return of word “foe”],

Schmitt & Heidegger give credit to oppositional logic (one Nietzsche smiles at) > Heidegger on technological deployment of modern ‘world wars,’ abandonment of Being, man as ‘most important raw material,’ lets his will be unconditionally equated w/ the process

BSi.content: for Schmitt, only political theories worthy of the name: pessimistic anthropology, man is a dangerous animal (i.e. Hobbes)
Schmitt: protego ergo obligo is cogito ergo sum of State
for Schmitt, what’s terrifying (schrecklich) about a Nation’s pretentious appeal to “humanity” is how such a nation treats its enemy as hors la loi, hors l’humanité—treats them like beasts
Schmitt doesn’t like hypocrisy of humanistic allegation/alibi > unehrliche Fiktion (dishonest fiction) of total depoliticization, peace w/out States
